src:
Ini Lintasan Formula E 2020 di DKI Jakarta
01 Nov 2019, 09:02 by Antara, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Teka-teki soal jalur yang akan digunakan dalam gelaran Formula E 2020 di Jakarta mulai terkuak. Dalam rapat dengan Komisi C DPRD DKI Jakarta Kamis kemarin, PT Jakarta Propertindo selaku pelaksana kegiatan tersebut membuka rencana lintasan balap jet listrik darat tersebut.
"Gelaran balapan mobil listrik tingkat internasional digelar pertama kali di Indonesia pada 6 Juni 2020 mendatang," kata Direktur Utama PT Jakpro Dwi Wahyu Daryoto di DPRD Jakarta, Kamis malam kemarin seperti dilansir Antara.
Dalam rapat bersama Komisi C DPDR DKI Jakarta itu disampaikan bahwa lintasan yang akan dilalui sepanjang 2,6 kilometer dengan titik awal (start) di Jalan Medan Selatan.
Selanjutnya lintasan akan menuju ke Jalan Medan Merdeka Timur lalu ke Jalan Silang Merdeka Tenggara. Kemudian mengikuti putaran di Jalan Titian Indah di dalam kawasan Monas menuju Jalan Silang Merdeka Barat Daya dan berakhir di Jalan Medan Merdeka Selatan.
Kegiatan itu juga dibagi empat zona, yakni Zona Formula E Managemen yang meliputiarea utama sirkuit. Zona Ekonomi lokal berada di Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat dan Jalan MH Thamrin.
Zona Usaha Mikro Kecil dan Menengah di Jalan Agus Salim, Jalan Kebon Sirih, Jalan Perwira dan Lapangan Banteng. Selain itu, ada pula Zona Konser di Stadion Gelora Bung Karno.
PT Jakarta Propertindo (Jakpro) merupakan Badan Usaha Milik Daerah (BUMD) yang ditunjuk oleh Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan sebagai pelaksana kegiatan telah mengusulkan anggaran sebesar Rp 767 miliar.
Selain sebagai pergelaran olahraga, Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan berharap pergelaran itu bisa ikut menggerakan perekonomian DKI Jakarta, terutama di bidang pariwisata.
text:
This is the Formula E 2020 Track in DKI Jakarta
Nov 01 2019, 09:02 by Antara, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The puzzle about the path that will be used in the Formula E 2020 event in Jakarta starts to unfold. In a meeting with the Commission C of DKI Jakarta DPRD last Thursday, PT Jakarta Propertindo as the executor of the activity opened the plan for the ground electric jet racing track.
"The international electric car race was held for the first time in Indonesia on June 6, 2020," said President Director of PT Jakpro Dwi Wahyu Daryoto at the Jakarta DPRD, Thursday night as reported by Antara.
In a joint meeting of Commission C of the DKI Jakarta DPDR, it was stated that the trajectory that will be traversed is 2.6 kilometers with a starting point on the South Medan Road.
Furthermore, the track will go to Jalan Medan Merdeka Timur then to Jalan Silang Merdeka Tenggara. Then follow the round on Jalan Titian Indah in the Monas area towards Jalan Silang Merdeka Barat Daya and end at Jalan Medan Merdeka Selatan.
The activity is also divided into four zones, namely the Formula E Management Zone which covers the main area of the circuit. The Local Economic Zone is on Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat and Jalan MH Thamrin.
Small and Medium Business Zone in Agus Salim Street, Kebon Sirih Street, Perwira Street and Banteng Field. In addition, there is also a Concert Zone at the Bung Karno Stadium.
PT Jakarta Propertindo (Jakpro) is a Regional-Owned Enterprise (BUMD) appointed by the Governor of DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan as the executor of the activity has proposed a budget of Rp 767 billion.
Aside from being a sports performance, DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan hopes that the performance can help move the economy of DKI Jakarta, especially in the tourism sector.
